thread.title: Hotel du Palais Bizutage Incident: Chef Claims Innocence and Prepares Defense
thread.title_full: Hotel du Palais Bizutage Incident: Chef Claims Innocence and Prepares Defense

author: archyde
title: Hotel du Palais Bizutage Incident: Chef Claims Innocence and Prepares Defense
text:
2023-12-28 21:30:26
Welcome
France
New Aquitaine
Pyrénées-Atlantiques
Dismissed following the publication of images of a “disturbing incident which took place on the premises of the hotel”, the starred chef Aurélien Largeau denies this and claims to be preparing his defense.
Published on 12/28/2023 10:30 p.m.
Reading time: 1 min The Hôtel du Palais in Biarritz hosted the G7 summit in 2019. (IROZ GAIZKA / AFP)
A preliminary investigation into sexual assault and violence at the Hôtel du Palais in Biarritz (Pyrénées-Atlantiques) was opened by the Bayonne public prosecutor’s office on Thursday December 28,
learned France Bleu Pays Basque. No complaint had been filed, the prosecution took matters into its own hands. Of the “images” of a “concerning incident that took place on the hotel premises” ont “circulated” on social networks, indicates the American group Hyatt which manages the site. Michelin-starred chef Aurélien Largeau, dismissed Thursday December 21, for its part refutes the existence of a “humiliating hazing of a kitchen assistant”.
The hotel group states in a press release that “This incident does not reflect the values that we all defend, an investigation was carried out and the appropriate decisions were taken.” “I would like to formally deny the allegations made against me,” answers Aurélien Largeau. “I condemn any form of mistreatment, hazing or humiliation within the brigades and more broadly, and I will never associate myself with such behavior.” he continues, indicating that he is preparing his defense with his lawyers in order to “stop the defamation”.
